filmography.title: The Invisible Man
filmography.role: The Invisible Man / Dr. Jack Griffin
filmography.role_description: A scientist who discovers the secret of invisibility but is driven to homicidal madness by the drug's side effects; Rains' breakout role where his face is only seen at the end.
filmography.plot: A scientist finds a way of becoming invisible, but in doing so, he becomes murderously insane.

filmography.title: Anthony Adverse
filmography.role_description: A cruel Spanish nobleman who kills his wife's lover in a duel and abandons her illegitimate child.
filmography.plot: In 18th-century Italy, a young man embarks on a journey of self-discovery that takes him across the world.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Gale Sondergaard)

filmography.title: The Prince and the Pauper
filmography.role_description: The scheming and ambitious advisor to the King who plots to seize power when he discovers the Prince has switched places with a pauper.
filmography.plot: A poor boy and a prince exchange identities, but events force the pauper to live the life of a king while the prince endures the hardships of the streets.

filmography.title: They Won't Forget
filmography.role_description: An ambitious prosecutor in the Deep South who uses a murder case to further his own political career, disregarding justice.
filmography.plot: A Northern teacher is accused of murdering a student in a Southern town, and a prosecutor exploits the case for political gain.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
filmography.role_description: The treacherous younger brother of King Richard who usurps the throne and taxes the poor, serving as the sophisticated villain to Robin Hood.
filmography.plot: When Prince John and the Norman Lords begin oppressing the Saxon commoners in King Richard's absence, a Saxon lord fights back as the outlaw leader of a rebel guerrilla army.

filmography.title: Four Daughters
filmography.role_description: A gentle, music-loving father who presides over a household of four spirited daughters.
filmography.plot: A musical family's life is disrupted when a cynical young composer enters their lives and charms the daughters.

filmography.title: Juarez
filmography.role_description: The French Emperor who installs a puppet government in Mexico, manipulating events from afar.
filmography.plot: In the 1860s, Mexican President Benito Juarez fights the French occupation and the puppet Emperor Maximilian.

filmography.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
filmography.role_description: A distinguished senior senator who has compromised his integrity for political power, becoming the antagonist to the idealistic Jefferson Smith.
filmography.plot: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

filmography.title: The Sea Hawk
filmography.role_description: A slick and scheming Spanish ambassador to the court of Queen Elizabeth I who plots the downfall of England.
filmography.plot: Geoffrey Thorpe, a buccaneer, is hired by Queen Elizabeth I to nag the Spanish Armada. The Armada is waiting for the attack on England and Thorpe surprises them with attacks on their galleons.

filmography.title: Here Comes Mr. Jordan
filmography.role_description: A suave and authoritative heavenly supervisor who tries to rectify a mistake when a boxer is taken to the afterlife 50 years too early.
filmography.plot: A boxer, mistakenly taken to heaven before his time, is given a second chance at life in a new body.

filmography.title: The Wolf Man
filmography.role_description: The stern but loving father of Larry Talbot, who refuses to believe in the werewolf curse until it is tragically too late.
filmography.plot: A practical man returns to his homeland, is attacked by a creature of folklore, and infected with a horrific disease his disciplined mind tells him can not possibly exist.

filmography.title: Kings Row
filmography.role_description: A brilliant but reclusive psychiatrist whose protective nature over his daughter masks a dark family secret.
filmography.plot: Five children in an apparently ideal American small town grow up, their lives darkened by hidden secrets, madness, and tragedy.

filmography.title: Now, Voyager
filmography.role_description: A wise and compassionate psychiatrist who helps a repressed spinster break free from her domineering mother and find self-worth.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist helps a repressed, unattractive woman blossom into an independent and elegant beauty, but her new lease on life is complicated by a doomed romance.

filmography.title: Casablanca
filmography.role_description: The corrupt, charming, and pragmatic French police prefect who navigates the politics of Vichy France and ultimately discovers his patriotism.
filmography.plot: A cynical expatriate American cafe owner struggles to decide whether or not to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco.

filmography.title: Phantom of the Opera
filmography.role_description: A timid violinist who is disfigured by acid and descends into madness, haunting the Paris Opera House to advance the career of a young soprano.
filmography.plot: A disfigured violinist haunts the Paris Opera House, committing murder to further the career of the soprano he loves.

filmography.title: Passage to Marseille
filmography.role_description: A Free French liaison officer who recounts the story of French convicts escaping Devil's Island to fight for their country.
filmography.plot: Five patriotic convicts escape Devil's Island to fight for Free French forces, becoming a bomber crew in England.

filmography.title: Mr. Skeffington
filmography.role_description: A patient and fiercely loyal Jewish stockbroker who marries a vain beauty and stands by her despite her selfishness and anti-Semitism.
filmography.plot: A vain woman who has many suitors marries a stockbroker for his money, only to find her beauty fading as she alienates everyone around her.

filmography.title: Caesar and Cleopatra
filmography.role_description: The aging Roman conqueror who takes the young Egyptian queen under his wing, teaching her how to rule.
filmography.plot: Julius Caesar conquers Egypt and takes the young Cleopatra under his wing to train her as a ruler.

filmography.title: Notorious
filmography.role_description: A wealthy Nazi sympathizer in South America who marries an American spy, only to discover her betrayal and plot her demise.
filmography.plot: A woman is asked to spy on a group of Nazi friends in South America. How far will she have to go to ingratiate herself with them?

filmography.title: Deception
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, egomaniacal composer who torments his former mistress and her new husband, a cellist.
filmography.plot: A music teacher marries her cellist lover after thinking her former lover, a famous composer, was dead, but the composer returns.

filmography.title: Angel on My Shoulder
filmography.role_description: The Devil himself, who makes a deal with a murdered gangster to return to Earth to corrupt a virtuous judge.
filmography.plot: A deceased gangster makes a deal with the Devil to return to Earth as a judge to avenge his murder.

filmography.title: The Unsuspected
filmography.role_description: A popular radio host who narrates murder mysteries on air while secretly committing the perfect crime in real life.
filmography.plot: A radio host commits the perfect crime, but his niece's husband has ideas of his own.

filmography.title: The Passionate Friends
filmography.role_description: The wealthy, understanding, yet ultimately heartbroken husband of a woman who cannot forget her first love.
filmography.plot: A woman marries a wealthy banker for security but continues to meet her former lover over the years.

filmography.title: The Man Who Watched Trains Go By
filmography.role_description: A meek Dutch bookkeeper who snaps after his boss embezzles the company funds, leading him on a criminal adventure in Paris.
filmography.plot: A henpecked clerk runs away to Paris with his company's funds and becomes involved with a dangerous woman.

filmography.title: Lawrence of Arabia
filmography.role_description: A shrewd British diplomat and intelligence leader who cynically manipulates the Arab Revolt for political gain.
filmography.plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I.

filmography.title: Twilight of Honor
filmography.role_description: An aging, cynical lawyer who mentors a younger attorney defending a man accused of murder.
filmography.plot: A young lawyer defends a man accused of murdering a town hero, aided by an older mentor.

filmography.title: The Greatest Story Ever Told
filmography.role_description: The paranoid King of Judea who orders the massacre of the innocents to protect his throne; Rains' final film role.
filmography.plot: An all-star retelling of the life of Jesus Christ, from his birth in Bethlehem to his crucifixion and resurrection.
